node.text:
Uncover the elaborate design process and #DiorSavoirFaire behind #DiorSignature sunglasses by @MariaGraziaChiuri, a collaboration between the #DiorEyewear design studio and the specialized expertise of @TheliosOfficial that progressed from technical drawings through initial prototypes and onto the finalized and produced pieces with their characteristic golden detailing and 1970s aesthetic.
© Video: @MelindaTriana 
Photo: @Valentin_Hennequin

node.text:
Actress @Efira_Virginie wore a #DiorCouture white silk chiffon draped dress by @MariaGraziaChiuri to attend the Dior x @VogueParis dinner held during the 74th @FestivaldeCannes. Swipe to see other #StarsinDior at the event - from @SandrineKiberlain and jury member @MGyllenhaal to @MelanieThierry, @GadElmaleh and @JeanneDamas - talk about their experience at the famous film festival.
#DiorCannes
© Photo: @Pierre__Mouton
Video : @Dnl.Darmon

node.title: Cannes Glamour at the Dior x Vogue Paris Dinner

node.text:
Get to know the story behind the look of the #DiorCouture Autumn-Winter 2021-2022 show. Follow @peterphilipsmakeup, Creative & Image Director of Dior Makeup, and the Dior models backstage!
•
#diormakeup #DiorCouture

node.text:
Every day starts with a good breakfast, but for actress and @DiorMakeup face @CaraDelevingne, this is no ordinary day - it's the unveiling of the #DiorCouture Autumn-Winter 2021-2022 collection by @MariaGraziaChiuri. Accompany her as she gets ready in her plush #DiorChezMoi robe, having fun choosing her beauty look for the day, nipping backstage to @PeterPhilipsMakeup for a final professional finish, and sharing her post-show thoughts.
© Film by @MelindaTriana

node.text:
The book 'Threads of Life: A History of the World Through the Eye of a Needle' proved a starting point for @MariaGraziaChiuri spark for the #DiorCouture Autumn-Winter 2021-2022 collection. And here its author @SewingMatters discusses the overlooked importance of sewing as a millennia-old form of visual communication, a repository for ideas of identity and place, and a means of connecting people and of sharing ideas around the world. 
© Clare Hunter is a community textile artist, curator & author based in Scotland. Threads of Life is published by Sceptre, Hodder & Stoughton (UK), Abrams Press (US), Bollati Boringhieri (Italy) & Uitgeverij Balans (Amsterdam).

node.title: Reclaiming the outsized role of sewing

© Video: @Dnl.Darmon

node.text:
Uncover the awesome effort required to realize the 340m2 of embroideries that lined the show space for the unveiling of the #DiorCouture Autumn-Winter 2021-2022 collection by @MariaGraziaChiuri. The motifs of artist Eva Jospin's work, 'Chambre de Soie', were divided into panels and interpreted as free-flowing embroideries involving 150 different kinds of stitches and techniques, and undertaken by 300 artisans at the @Chanakya.School in Mumbai, India. Founded in 2017 by the @Chanakya.In ateliers, the school preserves exceptional techniques and empowers women in local communities by training them as master craftspeople, in India a role traditionally reserved for men. This collection is thus a celebration of the transmission and richness of savoir-faire, a collective work glorifying the borderless beauty of craft. 
© Film by @MelindaTriana

node.text:
The stunningly detailed embroideries of its Sala dei Ricami inspired artist Eva Jospin for her work 'Chambre de Soie' which became the decor at the #DiorCouture Autumn-Winter 2021-2022 show from @MariaGraziaChiuri. Now discover the fascinating history of Rome's opulent art-filled Palazzo Colonna, its noble family and the famous figures with which it has been associated over the centuries.
© Film by Edoardo Winspeare

node.title: The story of the palazzo that sparked the couture scenography

node.text:
Meet Eva Jospin, the artist behind 'Chambre de Soie', the immense work that lined the show set for the #DiorCouture Autumn-Winter 2021-2022 collection by @MariaGraziaChiuri. She speaks about how her discovery of an embroidered room in a Roman palazzo would eventually lead to her collaboration with @Chanakya.School in Mumbai on translating her art into a creation composed of an eye-watering 340m2 of hand embroidery.
© Film by @MelindaTriana
Photo: Sophie Carre

node.title: The story of the show scenography

node.text:
A fundamental element of #DiorCouture Autumn-Winter 2021-2022 for @MariaGraziaChiuri who sought textiles with natural tones and a sense of texture and tactility, tweeds were specially developed for the collection by @Lanificio_Luigi_Colombo in Italy. Some of them were used for tailoring composed of patchworks of curving pattern pieces, while, on the flipside, feathers were also employed to recreate the same speckled effect.
#DiorSavoirFaire
© Film by @MelindaTriana
Photo: Sophie Carre

node.text:
Discover the #DiorCouture Autumn-Winter 2021-2022 collection by @MariaGraziaChiuri, a celebration of the materiality of fabric becoming form, and how the magic of savoir-faire and the communality of needlework render dreams a tactile reality in this return to physical presentations.
© Show set decor 'Chambre de Soie' by Eva Jospin embroidered by @Chanakya.School, Mumbai.

node.text:
Get to know @peterphilipsmakeup's, Creative & Image Director of Dior Makeup, beauty tips for the Dior Summer 2022 Men show looks. Get ready to be a backstage insider! 
• 
#diormakeup #diorbackstage #DiorSummer22 @olivierrosephotography

node.title: Peter Philips Makeup Talks - Dior Summer 22 Men’s Collection

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Dior Official on August 04, 2021 tagging @mariagraziachiuri, and @polbaril. May be an image of indoor.

node.text:
Key accessories in the unveiling of the #DiorAW21 collection by @MariaGraziaChiuri, these silk twill scarves wrapped heads to cultivate an air of glamorous mystery. Timeless examples of #DiorSavoirFaire, these highly versatile pieces featuring a reimagined exotic toile de Jouy motif and 'Christian Dior' signature border segue seamlessly into any look, whatever the season.
© @PolBaril

node.text:
A process bookended by exceptional examples of manual manipulation, the creation of this scarf from the #DiorAW21 collection by @MariaGraziaChiuri starts with the elaborate hand-rendering of its exotic toile de Jouy motif in the House's textile studio before the action moves to Italy where the silk twill is woven with the special inclusion of 'Christian Dior' jacquard borders. After washing, the lengths of fabric are digitally printed and cut to size before the final step in this elaborate undertaking sees the edges hand-rolled, an age-old technique that is a #DiorSavoirFaire signature.
© @PolBaril

node.text:
Scarves are essential elements of the #DiorAW21 collection by @MariaGraziaChiuri, figurative canvases for evocative imagery and creativity. Boldly bordered with the 'Christian Dior' signature, this navy and white version features a new iteration of the reimagined exotic toile de Jouy that has become a contemporary House classic, originating from a meticulously hand-drawn design in the textile studio. Stay tuned for the video detailing the #DiorSavoirFaire behind this sumptuous silk accessory.
© @PolBaril

node.text:
From sweet florals to bold #DiorOblique motifs, make a statement all your own with #DiorSilk scarves from the #DiorAW21 collection by @MariaGraziaChiuri. And stay tuned to see the #DiorSavoirFaire behind these timeless objects of desire.
© @BrigitteNiedermairStudio

node.text:
Twist, twirl and tie. Whether colorfully woven into a braid, adding an extra dimension to a matching #DiorBookTote or flutteringly framing the face, the #DiorSilk scarves of #DiorAW21 by @MariaGraziaChiuri allow each wearer to express their personality as mood and opportunity allow.
© @BrigitteNiedermairStudio

node.text:
Versatility is the name of the game when it comes to #DiorSilk scarves from #DiorAW21 by @MariaGraziaChiuri. Practicality and whimsy combine effortlessly, whether wrapping the hair in a 'Zodiac' motif, cinching a waist with 'Dior Around the World', or upping the 'Toile de Jouy' ante paired with #DiorChezMoi silk pajamas or encircling the face with a playful twist.
© @BrigitteNiedermairStudio

© @BrigitteNiedermairStudio
